page.title: 11DURHAM RACECOURSE
page.content: The racecourse was once used for horse racing, but now it is used for all kinds of sports. There is a cricket club and pitch used by Durham City Cricket Club, croquet lawn, a putting green, a climbing frame, a toilet for ladies and gents. The Rugby Club is next to the Cricket Club, and next to that is an allotment. The cricket ground and a field next to it is used by the N.U.M. every year for the Miners Gala. There are speeches and a march. Along the racecourse we counted only two litter bins. The boathouse is called St. Cuthberts Boathouse, and there is a shelter just along the path.
